greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the least positive integer > 1 such that 1-a(n)^k+a(n)^(2*k) is prime, where k=A003586[n]
comment: 1-m^k+m^(2*k) equals  Phi(6*k,m) when k=2^p*3^q, p>=0, q>=0, which may be prime numbers for certain positive integer m>1.
The Mathematica program given here generates the first 33 terms.  Further terms were generated by OpenPFGW.
mathematica: fQ[n_] := n == 3 EulerPhi@n; a = Select[6 Range@500, fQ]/6; l =
While[i++; cp = 1 - i^m + i^(2*m); ! PrimeQ[cp]]; i, {j, 1, l}]
results.author: _Lei Zhou_, Feb 01 2012
